com.milk.uberchat.gui
Class LocusPanel

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.awt.Component
        |
        +--java.awt.Container
              |
              +--javax.swing.JComponent
                    |
                    +--javax.swing.JPanel
                          |
                          +--com.milk.uberchat.gui.LocusPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.accessibility.Accessible, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable
public class LocusPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel

This is a panel which has all the guts for doing interaction in a particular locus. In particular, it's got a bigass area for the messages sent and received, an area for typing new messages, and some buttons for controlling stuff.

Author:
Dan Bornstein, danfuzz@milk.com
, Copyright 1999 Dan Bornstein, all rights reserved.
See Also:
Serialized Form

Nested Class Summary
private  class LocusPanel.FieldListener
          This is an ActionListener that listens to the salient stuff in this panel.
private  class LocusPanel.MyChangeListener
          This is a ChangeListener that listens to the viewport, so we can track scrolling pos etc.
private  class LocusPanel.MyEntityListener
          This is the EntityListener that listens to the locus.
private  class LocusPanel.MyMessageListener
          This is the MessageListener that listens to the locus tracker.

addLine

private void addLine(java.lang.String firstText,
                     javax.swing.text.Style firstStyle,
                     java.lang.String restText,
                     javax.swing.text.Style mainStyle)
Add a line of text to the document, possibly with a special first-run character style.

Parameters:
firstText - null-ok; the first text to add
firstStyle - null-ok; the character style for the first text
restText - non-null; the (rest of the) text to add
mainStyle - non-null; the main (paragraph) style for the text

speak

private void speak()
Speak in this locus. It grabs the values from the text field and speech kind to do its business.

windowClosing

private void windowClosing()
This is called via a WindowListener when the window that this panel is in is getting closed. It makes the panel stop getting chat messages.
